name: Hampton Inn & Suites Boulder North

reviews.text: This hotel was great - newly built and very comfortable. I had originally booked a hotel downtown near Pearl Street and was told about this Hampton Inn. Saved $1000 by rebooking to this hotel. So glad we switched! Great rooms, breakfast, pool and hot tub. Staff was very friendly also!
reviews.title: Great price for the area

reviews.text: A new Hampton Inn on the north side of Boulder, close to the canyons. The hotel is very nice, the finishes are done well and it is welcoming. At only one month old there was issues with hot water and room amenities. Overall, it's easy to get to and the staff is friendly.
reviews.title: North Boulder Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is beautiful, and the location worked very well for a 5 day vacation stay. I'd definitely stay here again! I travel for business, and this hotel was definitely a step above the standard Hampton Inn experience.
reviews.title: Great facilities, easy location

reviews.text: Rooms: We were upgraded to a junior suite. The room was very spacious; great closet space, large vanity. I loved having a wet bar & microwave seperate from the living/sleeping area. The sink did have a leak -- and we were comped a nights stay to make up for it. The hotel opened in July 2013, so this could easily be an opening-tweak. All in all, very comfortable and quiet.
reviews.title: Hampton Hotel, N. Boulder, CO.

reviews.text: Amneties: The pool and spa were terrific. The pool area was clean and stylish, and the spa was hot! Also loved the weight room -- multiple cardio machines, a full set of weights and comfortable bench, cool bosu toys, and a really nice pulley system. The lobby was very comforable, and the fireplace would be very charming in winter. The breakfast area was well appointed and laid out -- nice that it is seperate from the rest of the lounge.
reviews.title: Clean and adequate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This property is beautiful and brand new. The room was perfect and you can see the mountains from your window. Location near Boulder Reservoir is great too. They also have an indoor pool and hot tub which is fun.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel!

reviews.text: If you are looking for a beautiful hotel in one of the most beautiful locations this is the place to stay. It is relatively new so it sparkles everywhere and it is outside of town with a beautiful mountain view. Very family friendly!!
reviews.title: Boulder- and Beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night while in town for a wedding. The hotel was bright, clean, beautiful and private. It was amazing. We loved the wireless internet access in our room, the pool, the breakfast and the fact that we didn't hear any guests anywhere around us. The bed and clean, fresh linens were so comfy - we got a great night sleep! It was a great stay and we would definitely stay there again!
reviews.title: This hotel was amazing!

reviews.text: This is a good place to stay as a jumping off point for excursions into Boulder and the surrounding areas. The views aren't great, but all you really need is a place to sleep and shower and it's good for that. Complementary wi-fi, standard hotel breakfast, laundry and convenience store amenities, and spacious rooms with really comfortable beds are what you can expect here. Water pressure and temperature left a bit to be desired, but it is conveniently located and less expensive than some other hotel choices in and around Boulder.
reviews.title: New hotel with nice amenities for a stay near town

reviews.text: My work often puts me closer to Boulder than Denver so I was happy to find a brand new hotel so close to Boulder. The hotel rate was much less than other comparable hotels. The hotel is LEED certified so its air conditioning was quiet and super comfortable.
reviews.title: Brand new hotel makes a great place to stay.

reviews.text: This is a brand new property -- and the staff is justifiably proud of having been selected to work here. I found everyone pleasant and easy to work with. But, as others have noted, the property is missing some details.
reviews.title: Very nice -- but warning re: amenities for the next few weeks / months

reviews.text: The rooms don't come with fridge / micro -- or even a coffee machine yet. So, plan accordingly.
reviews.title: Boulder new hotel

reviews.text: My BIGGEST issue by far was that not all the rooms have blinds in them. Upon check-in, I was asked if I would "need the black-out blinds." I said I didn't need anything special - just the normal room.
reviews.title: Hampton Inn Boulder

reviews.text: A few hours later, as I was getting ready to go to bed, I realized that there were NO blinds at all -- just decorative drapes (which do not pull shut) and sheers. You could completely see in/out of the room.
reviews.title: Just a little off the Hampton Standard

reviews.text: THe rooms are large enough that safety and privacy wasn't really an issue. It was more the quality of sleep, since the rooms do open up onto parking lights.
reviews.title: Safety and Pleasant Stay

reviews.text: Very nice new hotel in growing north Boulder location. Great breakfast, with hot food seclections. Friendly staff. Located near Longmont and Boulder and easy to find. We will stay again when we are in the area. Is the newest hotels in the area.
reviews.title: Hampton Inn Boulder North

reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel at the end of a vacation in Colorado prior to catching a flight out of Denver International the next morning. The hotel is brand new and quite nice. The front desk service was very friendly and professional. Breakfast in the morning was good and better than expected (it included a few hot items in addition to the usual Continental breakfast items). The hotel is about 4 miles from downtown Boulder, but it is an easy drive that takes less than 10 minutes. It was about a 45 minute drive to DIA, but we wanted to stay closer to Boulder than Denver and that worked out well. My only complaint is that I thought the room rate was rather high for a smallish room in a mid-tier chain hotel outside of town.
reviews.title: Overnight Stay Near Boulder

reviews.text: Perfect conditions - clean, fresh, well organized. Very efficient and competent staff. Wonderful place to stay when traveling on business or for pleasure. I will use this hotel again. Parking lot was well lighted for evening arrivals and early morning departures. Beautiful grounds and landscaping.
reviews.title: Excellent Quality

reviews.text: Super new hotel with all the expected quality of a Hampton. Friendly staff and convienient access to many businesss locations. Grocery a block away, even a local Winery with Wine tasting less than a block away. Resturants not quite as close, but nearby.
reviews.title: New and friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A spanking new green hotel, seeking "Gold Level" LEED status. The lobby is "colorado elegant," with high ceilings, wood and plenty of glass. My suite was clean and spacious, at the end of the hallway, far above and away from any noise. Close to highways to Boulder and Longmont. Plenty of parking, indoor pool and spa. Complimentary wifi. Sweet shop (store on site for a late night candy bar or treat.
reviews.title: Slick and Green!

description: A welcoming LEED Certified hotel in North Boulder, CO.Conveniently set in the key Gunbarrel business district of North Boulder, Colorado – one of the ‘greenest’ cities in the U.S. - the Hampton Inn and Suites Boulder North is close to the University of Colorado, Folsom Field and many local and national companies including IBM, Covidien, HP, Spectra Logic, GE and numerous government contractors and labs. This LEED Certified hotel in Boulder, CO, also offers easy access to Longmont, the vintage town of Niwot and many Boulder attractions, including Boulder Reservoir, Estes Park and the Flatirons.All of the stylish guest rooms at this North Boulder hotel offer a range of modern amenities, including a comfortable, clean and fresh Hampton bed®, free WiFi, an ergonomic desk and an HDTV. Suites are also available at the hotel, featuring a sofa bed, microwave and refrigerator - perfect for families or longer stays. Start your day with Hampton’s free hot breakfast buffet, or grab a free Hampton On the Run™ Breakfast Bag, available Monday through Friday, for a quick, healthy meal to go. Our convenient 24-hour Suite Shop stocks a variety of snacks and last minute travel essentials. Work out in the free fitness center or swim in the indoor pool. Stay connected with the free business center, offering a range of services and amenities, hold a meeting in our conference room or for a smaller event, choose our Boardroom, which features stunning views of the Flatiron Mountains.
